question: Which of the following is correct regarding "Hans Geiger", who is known for the Geiger-Marsden Experiment which discovered the atomic nucleus?
explanation: Hans Geiger, who is known for the Geiger-Marsden Experiment which discovered the atomic nucleus, was a German Physicist. Johannes Wilhelm "Hans" Geiger (30 September 1882 – 24 September 1945) was a German physicist. He is best known as the co-inventor of the detector component of the Geiger counter and for the Geiger–Marsden experiment which discovered the atomic nucleus. He is known for Geiger counter, Geiger–Marsden experiment, Geiger–Müller tube, Geiger–Nuttall law and Atomic nucleus. He was a recipient of awards such as Hughes Medal in1929 and Duddell Medal and Prize in 1937.
